verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
udvāharkṣaṁ ca vijñāya
rukmiṇyā madhusūdanaḥ
rathaḥ saṁyujyatām āśu
dārukety āha sārathim

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; udvāha—of the wedding; ṛkṣam—the lunar asterism (the measurement that fixes the exact auspicious time); ca—and; vijñāya—knowing; rukmiṇyāḥ—of Rukmiṇī; madhusūdanaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; rathaḥ—the chariot; saṁyujyatām—should be readied; āśu—immediately; dāruka—O Dāruka; iti—thus; āha—He said; sārathim—to His driver.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Lord Madhusūdana also understood the exact lunar time for Rukmiṇī's wedding. Thus He told His driver, "Dāruka, ready My chariot immediately."
